question: What treasure did the man find hidden in a field?
explanation: Jesus simply calls it 'treasure' without specifying what it was; the kingdom of heaven is like this treasure.

verses.kjv: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

question: What separated the rich man from Lazarus in the afterlife?
explanation: And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been set in place, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.

verses.kjv:
And beside all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed: so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot; neither can they pass to us, that
would come from thence.

question: What happened to the guest without wedding clothes?
choices: He was thrown out into darkness
explanation: Then the king told the attendants, 'Tie him hand and foot, and throw him outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'

verses.kjv:
Then said the king to the servants, Bind him hand and foot, and take him away, and cast
him into outer darkness; there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

question: In the parable of the shrewd manager, what did the manager do when he was about to be fired?
explanation: The manager called in his master's debtors and reduced their bills so they would take care of him after he lost his job.

verses.kjv:
So he called every one of his lordâ€™s debtors
unto him,
 and said unto the first, How much owest thou unto my lord?
And he said, An hundred measures of oil. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and sit down quickly, and write fifty.
Then said he to another, And how much owest thou? And he said, An hundred measures of wheat. And he said unto him, Take thy bill, and write fourscore.

question: In the parable of the persistent widow, what was she seeking from the judge?
explanation: And there was a widow in that town who kept coming to him with the plea, 'Grant me justice against my adversary.'

verses.kjv: And there was a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, Avenge me of mine adversary.

question: In the parable of the rich fool, what did the man plan to do with his abundant crops?
explanation: Then he said, 'This is what I'll do. I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store my surplus grain.'

verses.kjv: And he said, This will I do: I will pull down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my fruits and my goods.

question: In the parable of the vineyard workers, when did the last workers start working?
explanation: About five in the afternoon (the eleventh hour) he went out and found still others standing around.

verses.kjv: And about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others standing idle, and saith unto them, Why stand ye here all the day idle?

question: What did the unmerciful servant owe his master in the parable?
explanation: As he began the settlement, a man who owed him ten thousand bags of gold was brought to him.

verses.kjv: And when he had begun to reckon, one was brought unto him, which owed him ten thousand talents.
